title: MAFS: Jo McPharlin says she has 'zero money' and asks for help
text:
Almost two years after winning hearts on Married At First Sight, Jo McPharlin is back - and this time she's begging fans to help her renovate her home.

Taking to Instagram on Wednesday, the 40-year-old former reality star told her followers she wants to transform her bedroom 'before Christmas'.

But after admitting she has 'zero money' to work with, Jo called on design experts, including 'people from The Block', to help her out for free.

'Help me!' Almost two years after winning hearts on Married At First Sight, Jo McPharlin is back - and this time she's begging fans to help her renovate her home

'I literally have the same bedroom. I've been in [the] same house for 15 years,' she explained.

'It's gone through a divorce, it's gone through a relationship, and now I just want to make it my little oasis, my little creature comfort home away from home.'

Despite being a self-confessed 'very private person', Jo gave her followers a tour of her 'small' bedroom while saying: 'I have no idea what I am doing at all.'

In need of a makeover: Taking to Instagram on Wednesday, the 40-year-old former reality star told her followers she wants to transform her bedroom 'before Christmas'

Looking for help: After admitting she has 'zero money' to work with, Jo called on design experts, including 'people from The Block', to help her out for free

'I have, like, zero money! I have $1,000. I want to know what's in, what's not, how you can help me,' she said.

Panning the camera around the space, Jo revealed her bedroom contained only a bed, two bedside tables, a cupboard and a tall boy dresser.

She said she wants to incorporate a feature wall in the room, and is considering sanding down the knobs on her bed frame and her dressers to 'save some money'.

Flower power? Jo is desperate to replace her floral curtains, which she says are 'horrendous'

Remember them? Jo is pictured on Married At First Sight with her ex-'husband', Sean Donnelly

But she was adamant about replacing her floral curtains, which she described as 'horrendous'.

'When we moved in 15 years ago, everything was pink, pink and pink, and my room is the last one to [be renovated],' she said of her home.

She concluded by asking 'anyone with interior design' knowledge to help her out, pleading: 'People, please help. Please help me.'
description: Almost two years after winning hearts on Married At First Sight, Jo McPharlin is back - and this time she's begging fans to help her renovate her home.
authors: Demeter Stamell For Daily Mail Australia
